name: tackiness
content:
tackiness noun [U]
(low quality)
Add to word list
Add to word list
informal disapproving cheap or low quality, or bad style: the tackiness of the souvenirs on sale
More examplesFewer examplesA veneer of tackiness lies over the whole venture. Some locals have grumbled about tackiness, but others welcome the spiritual icon and the attention it draws.People love a bit of tackiness at Christmas. This holiday park offers a seaside setting without the tackiness.The programme took a swerve towards tackiness with a trio of glitzy, gala-style divertissements.So are weddings in Las Vegas the last word in tackiness or the ultimate in spontaneous romance?

tackiness noun [U]
(stickiness)
the quality of being slightly sticky: the tackiness of the surface See
tacky
More examplesFewer examplesThe dough shouldn't be too sticky but may have some tackiness.He placed a hand against the child's forehead, feeling the tackiness of his skin.
